intro: Calandrinia venusta, commonly known as the showy purslane, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for arid environments. Calandrinia venusta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance.
